get.summary: Performs pricing evaluation per pricing rule to create a price schedule for each product.

parameters.name: MS-CV
parameters.description: Correlation Vector for the request. Must be sent as header or as query string parameter.

parameters.name: x-generationid
parameters.description: Generation Id the request.

parameters.name: bigIds
parameters.description: a comma separated list of bigIds to hydrate.

parameters.name: market
parameters.description: Filters the product sections based on this market.

parameters.name: languages
parameters.description: Filters the product based on the first found language (using fallback rules) in this comma delimited list.

parameters.name: catalogId
parameters.description: Filters the product based on the availabilities which match this catalogId.  If this is a private catalog, AuthZ checks are enforced.

parameters.name: enforceCatalogAuth
parameters.description: Enforces resource set authentication.

get.summary: Gets the product and query suggestions for a searched term

parameters.description: Correlation Vector for the request. Must be sent as header or as query string parameter

parameters.name: market
parameters.description: the desired market

parameters.name: languages
parameters.description: comma separated list of the desired languages used for localized data

parameters.name: rank
parameters.description: the rank for the AutoSuggest; allowed values: "AutosuggestApps","AutosuggestCanaryApps", "AutosuggestVideo", "AutosuggestCanaryVideo", "AutosuggestMusic", "AutosuggestCanaryMusic"

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: the autosuggest query that is searched for

parameters.name: catalogId
parameters.description: requested catalog

parameters.name: countProducts
parameters.description: the number of product suggestions returned; maximum value: 10

parameters.name: countQueries
parameters.description: the number of query suggestions returned; maximum value: 10

parameters.name: platformDependenciesName
parameters.description: the platform name(s) for the query (example: Windows.Windows8x+OR+Windows.Desktop)

parameters.name: architecture
parameters.description: the desired architecture

parameters.name: hardware
parameters.description: the desired hardware constraints (three-letter codes, comma delimited)

parameters.name: productType
parameters.description: the product type

get.summary: Returns the set of content ratings.
get.description: This API returns ratings metadata information. This is essentially "domain data" for ratings, although the ratings data is different from standard domain data and this is why this is a separate endpoint. The API is used to retrieve ratings metadata for a single market and language. Optionally, a domain parameter allows filtering on ratings for a specific media type (application, game, movie, tv). The response object is a dictionary of rating boards, each of which contains a set of ratings. For example, ESRB is a rating board for games containing ratings of ESRB:T and ESRB:E, among others. Each rating and rating board contains a set of market and localized properties. Each rating also contains an age, which represents the minimum age of the user that this content is appropriate for per the rating board. A set of restrictions are defined on the rating to determine what is restricted if a user does not meet the minimum age requirement. There is also a priority defined on each rating board, which determines which rating's minimum age requirement to apply if more than one rating applies to a product (lowest priority numeral wins; i.e., a rating board with priority of 1 wins over a rating board of priority of 2). All rating boards in a market are guaranteed to have a unique priority. For more information about this API or general information about all catalog APIs, refer to the catalog API documentation.

parameters.name: MS-CV
parameters.description: Correlation Vector for the request. Must be sent as header or as query string parameter

parameters.name: market
parameters.description: The desired market.

parameters.name: languages
parameters.description: A comma separated list of the desired languages used for localized data.

parameters.name: domain
parameters.description: The domain (game, tv, video, application...) to query.

get.summary: Returns the set of content ratings.
get.description:
This API returns ratings metadata information. This is essentially "domain data" for ratings, although
        the ratings data is different from standard domain data and this is why this is a separate endpoint.
        The API is used to retrieve ratings metadata for a single market and language. Optionally, a domain
        parameter allows filtering on ratings for a specific media type (application, game, movie, tv).
        The response object is a dictionary of rating boards, each of which contains a set of ratings.
        For example, ESRB is a rating board for games containing ratings of ESRB:T and ESRB:E, among others.
        Each rating and rating board contains a set of market and localized properties. Each rating also contains
        an age, which represents the minimum age of the user that this content is appropriate for per
        the rating board. A set of restrictions are defined on the rating to determine what is restricted if a user
        does not meet the minimum age requirement. There is also a priority defined on each rating board,
        which determines which rating's minimum age requirement to apply if more than one rating applies
        to a product (lowest priority numeral wins; i.e., a rating board with priority of 1 wins over a rating
        board of priority of 2). All rating boards in a market are guaranteed to have a unique priority.

BigIds.description: Gets the list of big ids.

HasMorePages.description: Gets or sets the bool indicating whether or not there are more pages in this result.

Products.description: Gets the list of hydrated products.

TotalResultCount.description: Gets or sets the total result count.
